channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-14429] FTPFileSystem#getFsAction always returns FsAction.NONE
item.description:
private FsAction getFsAction(int accessGroup, FTPFile ftpFile) {
      FsAction action = FsAction.NONE;
      if (ftpFile.hasPermission(accessGroup, FTPFile.READ_PERMISSION)) {
      action.or(FsAction.READ);
  }
    if (ftpFile.hasPermission(accessGroup, FTPFile.WRITE_PERMISSION)) {
      action.or(FsAction.WRITE);
    }
    if (ftpFile.hasPermission(accessGroup, FTPFile.EXECUTE_PERMISSION)) {
      action.or(FsAction.EXECUTE);
    }
    return action;
  }

from code above, we can see that the getFsAction method doesnot modify the action generated by FsAction action = FsAction.NONE,which means it return FsAction.NONE all the time;

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: upload patch
modify FTPFileSystem getFsAction method to get correct FsAction

None of this related with this patch.

Hi Hongyuan Li,

Thanks for the updated patch.

What about remove the map and do:

  @Test
  public void testGetFsAction() throws IOException {
    FTPFileSystem ftp = new FTPFileSystem();
    int[] accesses = new int[] {FTPFile.USER_ACCESS, FTPFile.GROUP_ACCESS,
        FTPFile.WORLD_ACCESS};
    FsAction[] actions = FsAction.values();
    for(int i = 0; i < accesses.length; i++){
      for(int j = 0; j < actions.length; j++){
        FTPFile ftpFile = getFTPFile(accesses[i], actions[j]);
        assertEquals(actions[j], ftp.getFsAction(accesses[i], ftpFile));
      }
    }
    ftp.close();
  }

?

Seems this makea the code more simplified.

Thanks.
Nice advice. Resubmit patch as you suggested.

latest patch sounds good.Great suggestions from yzhangal.
Minor nits:
i) can you remove unused imports..?
ii) will it be good to add some message here..? assertEquals(" ",)
iii) how about changing the method name getFTPFile since it will create and setpermission also..?
